SUMMARY.Coronavirus: Maruti Suzuki halts product:
New Delhi: Maruti Suzuki India Ltd, country’s largest vehicle manufacturer, on Sunday, announced its decision to stop manufacturing vehicles in the two factories located in Haryana, indefinitely.
Work at the research and development centre in Rohtak will also be stopped from tomorrow.
“The government policy now requires closure of production and accordingly the company has taken a decision on production closure.
The company will shut production and office operations at its facilities in Gurugram and Manesar, Haryana, with immediate effect till further notice.
None of the plants are working on Sunday, March 22, 2020,"said Mahindra and Manhindra in a regulatory filing on Sunday.

The YSRCP government in Andhra Pradesh has decided to go ahead with the launch of its flagship housing scheme for the poor, and has announced that the distribution of ‘pattas’ or title deeds to the beneficiaries will be done on April 14.
While the pattas were earlier scheduled to be distributed on March 25, on the occasion of Ugadi, or Telugu New Year’s Day, it was first delayed due to the State Election Commission’s objection ahead of the local body polls, and now postponed again due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos said in a statement on Saturday the company is hiring for 100,000 new roles, and urged laid-off restaurant workers to apply.
Bezos added that the company has implemented a number of health and safety measures in response to the crisis, and has raised wages for hourly workers.
Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos is urging laid-off workers from closed-down restaurants and bars to come join the company as it struggles to accommodate an enormous volume of orders amid the coronavirus pandemic.
Bezos added that the company has implemented a number of health and safety measures in response to the crisis.
Last week, the first known coronavirus case at an Amazon warehouse was confirmed at a facility in Queens, New York.

SUMMARY.Do Saudi Arabia, Russia Target US Shale:
By slashing 500,000 bpd, Saudi Arabia reduced production by 4.5% from 10.56 million bpd, and Russia curtailed its output by 300,000 bpd.
As newly appointed Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia, Mohammad attended the inaugural ceremony of the World Cup tournament in Moscow in June 2018 as Putin’s guest.
Saudi Aramco also announced that it would raise output to an unprecedented 12.3 million bpd from the current 9.8 million bpd.
In Saudi Arabia, the petroleum sector accounts for roughly 85% of the kingdom’s revenue, 90% of export earnings and 42% of GDP.
Earlier, pressured by cheap Saudi oil in 2015, the US shale oil industry reduced its breakeven point from $65 to $46 a barrel.
SUMMARY.India set to switch to world's cleanest:
This is the third straight reduction in jet fuel rates since February, which make up for as much as 40 percent of an airline's running cost.
But on Saturday, oil firms decided to revert to fortnightly revisions to pass on the benefit of falling international oil prices to the airlines.
Petrol and diesel prices, which are changed on a daily basis, however remained unchanged since March 16.
ATF price comes to Rs 50.17 per litre and is cheaper than present rate of petrol and diesel.
The reduction in jet fuel prices comes as a relief to airline industry which has seen widespread flight cancellations and travel bans in view of the coronavirus pandemic.
SUMMARY.Coronavirus Outbreak: Banks To Provide O:
In an effort to contain the rising positive cases of coronavirus in India, banks will only provide essential services to customers starting Monday, March 23.
A statement by the Indian Banks Association (IBA) on Sunday said banks will ensure to provide at least four essential services - cash deposits and withdrawals, cheque deposition, remittances and government transactions - at branches across the country.
The lock down clamped across states to contain spread of coronavirus will limit the ability to commute, impacting ability to provide banking services.
Most of the services that banks offer are available online.
Customers should use the mobile and online banking channels for non-essential services.

MUMBAI: Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd (M&M) will shut down its tractor production facility in Nagpur with immediate effect, joining the ranks of other automobile makers taking steps to protect their workers against the deadly coronavirus.
All operations at its Chakan (Pune) and Kandivali (Mumbai) units will close down by end of Monday, a company release sent to the stock exchanges said.
None of the plants are working today, March 22," the company said in a note released to the BSE on Sunday.
Over the last two days, automakers such as Tata Motors Ltd, FCA India Automobiles Pvt Ltd and Hero MotoCorp Ltd have issued official statements announcing closures of their respective production units.
Hero MotoCorp has shut production at all its plants worldwide till 31 March.

SUMMARY.Hand sanitiser, face mask prices capped,:
FMCG players like HUL, Godrej Consumer and Patanjali said they are helping fight the Covid-19 outbreak by reducing the prices of soaps and hygiene products and ramping up production of these items.
Market leader Hindustan Unilever Ltd (HUL) on Friday committed Rs 100 crore to help in combating the coronavirus pandemic.
"In the public interest, HUL is reducing the prices of Lifebuoy sanitizers, Lifebuoy Liquid handwash and Domex floor cleaners by 15 per cent.
HUL will donate 2 crore pieces of Lifebuoy soaps in the next few months to the sections of the society which need it the most.
Haridwar-based Patanjali Ayurved said it has slashed prices of aloe vera and haldi-chandan soap variants by 12.5 per cent.
SUMMARY.Coronavirus testing: US approves rapid t:
Washington: The US Food and Drug Administration on Saturday approved a coronavirus diagnostic test that can be conducted entirely at the point-of-care and can deliver results in 45 minutes.
Cepheid said the test has been designed to operate on any of its more than 23,000 automated GeneXpert Systems worldwide, with a detection time of approximately 45 minutes.
Cepheid currently has nearly 5,000 GeneXpert Systems in the US capable of point-of-care testing and for use in hospitals, said Cepheid President Warren Kocmond.
FDA Commissioner Stephen Hann said this marks an important step in expanding the availability of testing and rapid results.
With today's authorisation, there is now an option for testing at the point-of-care, which enables patient access to more immediate results," he said.

SUMMARY.India\u2019s forex reserves plunge the m:
Mumbai: The rupee gave up its day's gains to settle 8 paise lower at a fresh life-time low of 75.20 against the US dollar on Friday as forex market continued to grapple with economic uncertainties due to fast-spreading coronavirus pandemic.
At the interbank foreign exchange market, the domestic currency opened higher at 74.82 and gained more strength as the day progressed.
The Indian unit finally settled at 75.20, down 8 paise against the US dollar.
This uncertainty and hysteria have grappled the forex market, depreciating all emerging market currencies and taking rupee to record low of 75.30 zone," Rahul Gupta, Head of Research - Currency, Emkay Global Financial Services, said.
Updated Date: Mar 20, 2020 19:25:10 ISTTags : Coronavirus, COVID-19, Currency, Dollars, Forex, Indian Currency, Indian Rupee, NewsTracker, Rupee, US Dollars

On Thursday, the precious metal had closed at Rs 40,310 per 10 gram.
(Image for Representation: Reuters)Gold prices on Friday jumped Rs 1,395 to Rs 41,705 per 10 gram in the national capital following rally in the international prices of the precious metal, according to HDFC Securities.
Silver prices also advanced Rs 2,889 to Rs 38,100 per kg against the previous close of Rs 35,211 per kg.
"Spot gold of 24 karat in Delhi shot up by Rs 1,395 with overnight rally in international gold prices," HDFC Securities Senior Analyst (Commodities) Tapan Patel said.
"Gold prices traded higher with broad-based recovery in commodities," he added.

SUMMARY.Twitter says won\u2019t remove Musk\u201:
techUpdated: Mar 21, 2020 16:13 ISTTwitter has said it will not remove a controversial tweet by Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk that children are “essentially immune” to the new coronavirus.
The micro-blogging platform flouted its own new rules which say misinformation about children and the coronavirus is kind of content that need to be removed.
A Twitter spokesperson told CNN Business on Friday that it reviewed Musk’s tweet and determined it did not break its rules.
Musk had tweeted: “Kids are essentially immune, but elderly with existing conditions are vulnerable.
Musk’s assertion was contradicted at a White House podium by global health expert Dr Deborah Birx, the White House coronavirus task force response coordinator.

SUMMARY.Covid-19: Banks brace for downing shutte:
Some are bracing up for downing shutters on branches in case cities go into a lockdown with a possible explosion of the disease (COVID-19) cases.
“The number of customers visiting bank branches has come down in recent days.
But it will be done in a manner that the customers remain unaffected,” a chief executive of a Mumbai-based state-owned bank said.
Banks have been taking precautions to protect both employees and customers from infection.
Quick response teams will be formed to handle “exigencies, in case of upsurge in the spread of COVID-19”.

SUMMARY.Motilal Oswal board okays Rs 150 crore s:
Emami is making the buyback offer at a price of Rs 300 per share.
Three companies – Emami, Dalmia Bharat and Motial Oswal Financial Services – have informed the stock exchanges that they will buy back shares in the open market.
While Motilal Oswal will make a buy-back offer of Rs 150 crore, Emami is planning for a buyback of over Rs 191 crore, and Dalmia Bharat will make an offer of Rs 500 crore, according to their BSE filings.
Motilal Oswal will make the offer at a price not exceeding Rs 650 per share, while Dalmia Bharat’s offer will be at a price of Rs 700 per equity share.
Motilal Oswal’s share price closed up 9.48% at Rs 605.60 on the BSE on Friday, while Dalmia Bharat’s share price closed up 5.06% at Rs 511.10.
SUMMARY.Coronavirus impact: Companies decide to:
IndiGo said on Friday that it will be operating 60 per cent of its domestic flights on Sunday.
IndiGo said on Friday that it will be operating 60 per cent of its domestic flights on Sunday when ''Janta curfew'' would be in force.
Moreover, as the airline has seen reduction in demand due to the pandemic, it will be operating 25 per cent less domestic flights for now.
On Thursday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi had urged citizens to observe Janta curfew by not going out of their homes from 7 am to 9 am on Sunday amid novel coronavirus pandemic.
In this "fluid" situation, IndiGo said it will continually review operations to match capacity to demand.

SUMMARY.Janata Curfew: Ola & Uber to Offer Limit:
Bengaluru: Cab hailing platform Uber has temporarily suspended its pool rides in India in a bid to contain the spread of coronavirus (Covid-19).
The decision comes at a time when the authorities are asking for social distancing to contain outbreak of the virus.
In line with the Government advisory, we urge people to stay safe and discourage non-essential travel," said an Uber spokesperson in a statement.
It had earlier urged drivers to observe a self-imposed curfew on 22 March, Sunday.
Ola and Uber currently employ more than 30 lakh drivers in India, as per industry estimates in 2019.

SUMMARY.MTNL\u2019s special work from home offer:
Public sector companies are the first one to come up with schemes to support work from home amid Coronavirus scare.
(File Photo)MTNL Broadband Best Plan: State-run telecom firm MTNL will offer double data in all broadband plans of landline and mobile for a month to encourage work from home for people in the wake of rising cases of coronavirus in the country.
“MTNL has doubled free data in all the broadband plans of landline as well as mobile for one month will effect from today so that people are encouraged to work from home,” MTNL Chairman and Managing Director Sunil Kumar told PTI.
On Friday, it announced free broadband service for its landline and new customers for a month to support ‘work from home’ allowed by most organisations amid the coronavirus outbreak.
Public sector companies are the first one to come up with schemes to support work from home.

Incorporated in 1986, Motherson Sumi is a largecap company with a market cap of Rs 20210.78 crore, operating in the auto ancillaries sector.
FinancialsMotherson Sumi Systems' key products/revenue segments include auto electricals which contributed Rs 7293.40 crore to sales value (96.20 per cent of total sales), sale of services which contributed Rs 114.80 crore to sales value (1.51 per cent of total sales), traded goods which contributed Rs 102.50 crore to sales value (1.35 per cent of total sales), scrap which contributed Rs 33.40 crore to sales value (0.44 per cent of total sales) and export incentives which contributed Rs 19.40 crore to sales value (0.25 per cent of total sales).
Other oOperating revenue contributed Rs 16.50 crore to sales value (0.21 per cent of total sales) and job work contributed Rs 1.30 crore to sales value (0.01 per cent of total sales)for the year ending 31-Mar-2019.
The company has reported net profit after tax of Rs 318.51 crore in latest quarter.

SUMMARY.All New Hero Xtreme 160R Listed On Offic:
Hero MotoCorp is working to launch its sports tourer, the Xtreme 160R, in India sometime soon.
In the latest update, the motorcycle has debuted on the company's official website, hinting at an imminent launch in the country.
Design A look at the Hero Xtreme 160RThe Hero Xtreme 160R gets a minimalistic look with a semi-faired design, featuring an angular-looking headlamp cluster, two-tone color scheme, and blacked-out alloy wheels and exhaust.
Information Power and performanceThe Hero Xtreme 160R is fueled by a BS6-compliant 160cc single-cylinder fuel-injected engine that is capable of producing 15PS of maximum power at 8,000rpm and 14Nm of peak torque at 6,500rpm.
In the safety department, the Hero Xtreme 160R comes equipped with disc brakes on both the front and rear ends, along with single-channel ABS for better grip on the road.
SUMMARY.TCS says it can only allow 40% of its st:
While a majority of Tata group companies have asked employees to totally work out of home, the option has been restricted to about 40% of TCS employees globally.
A number of critical utilities bank on TCS' back-end IT support and therefore TCS can't entirely operate from home, the official said.
"TCS has enabled work from home for 40% of TCS associates using Secure Borderless Workspaces infrastructure, as per the note.
"Our teams are working on war footing to enable for the rest in conjunction with client teams globally so that we can be prepared for any eventualities.
Unforeseen scenarios, given the unprecedented global scale of the impact, are being dealt with expeditiously," the note stated.All other group.
